intro: Nauenburgia trinervata, commonly known as the three-veined nauenburgia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Nauenburgia trinervata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
